intro: Lepiurus filiformis, commonly known as the slender lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its lack of true leaves and its parasitic growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, and it relies on a network of haustoria to absorb nutrients from its host plants. Lepiurus filiformis thrives in nutrient-poor soils and is often found growing in association with grasses and sedges in open, cold environments.
